job_desc:
Bubble enables thousands of businesses around the world to build software solutions without code. Our users use Bubble to build VC-backed startups, personal projects, and internal company tools. We are often a critical part of our customers’ operations and are very proud to help businesses achieve success through more accessible software.


We are one of the fastest growing companies in the New York tech ecosystem: after a few years of bootstrapping and product development, we’re now looking to hire our first Brand / Visual Designer. This is an exciting opportunity to set the creative strategy and visual language for an industry-defining product.


In particular, as our Brand / Visual Designer, you would:

  • Define, iterate, and extend the visual language of Bubble across marketing, including our marketing website, blog, email campaigns, marketing and advertising assets, affiliate & partner marketing, and social media
  • Create original creative that is informed by business needs, strategy, customer research, and leadership input
  • Collaborate effectively across marketing, product, leadership, and other stakeholders with a low-ego / solutions-focused mindset
  • Build entire visual campaigns from start to finish and implement across all acquisition channels
  • Develop longer-term creative strategy for Bubble’s marketing communications

 

We're looking for someone with the following characteristics:

 

  • 3+ years of experience creating effective visual design solutions for brand marketing (including experience in print, web, and video)
  • A portfolio that demonstrates a strong understanding of consistency, typography, color, design systems across web and mobile, and conceptualizing brand identity
  • Strong end-to-end ownership of design work from kick-off to final asset creation
  • Ability to effectively communicate design rationale to internal team and other stakeholders
  • Experience defining and contributing to design systems
  • Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite

 

If this sounds like you, apply! We look forward to hearing from you.

 

 

At Bubble, we encourage people from all ages, abilities, and experiences to apply. Bubble does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy or caregiver status, veteran status, or any other legally protected status.

 

 

Bubble is very remote-friendly, and we have employees who work across the United States. You’ll be able to identify which state you plan to work in on your application. Note: at this time, we are only considering candidates who are authorized to work in the U.S.

 

 

 #LI-Remote

job: Product Designer II, Enterprise Experience Design
job_desc:
Product Designer II, Enterprise Experience Design
About The Team
Disney Streaming is changing how people watch sports, movies, and television. Fans demand content on their own terms: anywhere, anytime on any device. Our mission is to create the best entertainment experience and push the envelope of what's possible.
The Enterprise Experience Design team designs the software and processes that operate our streaming services: Disney+, Hulu, STAR+ and ESPN+. Our mission is to make Disney smarter, more agile and better connected to our guests. We work on a diverse portfolio of products ranging from content management, business intelligence to customer lifecycle. We believe well-designed tools have helped open new creative possibilities across marketing, editorial and operations.
About The Role
We're looking for a Product Designer to help design the platform that runs Disney+, Hulu, ESPN+ and Star+. The design challenge will be to build beautifully-designed applications that make our internal teams more agile, informed and efficient. We believe that well-designed tools do more than make our jobs better, they change how we look at the world. The conversation moves from, "How can we do this?" to "What else can we do?"
This role reports to our Lead Designer, Enterprise XD in New York. This role can be located near any of our offices: New York, Santa Monica, San Francisco, Seattle or Burbank. We are using a flexible hybrid model that focuses on Moments that Matter for in-person collaboration.
What You'll Do
  • Design an end to end user experience, including research (sometimes with the UX research team), concepts, wireframes, prototypes, pixel-perfect UI, documentation, and testing
  • Ideate multiple solutions using sketches, wireframes and prototypes while instinctively knowing the proper level of detail to communicate your point of view to peers and stakeholders.
  • Build sustainable and scalable solutions by using and contributing to our design systems.
  • Follow a user-centered design process, understanding real users motivations, behaviors and goals. Our teams focus on listening to fans, and letting their needs guide us to the best solutions. It's important for us to know we are solving for real people and not just the competition or stakeholders.
  • Work with small multi-disciplinary teams. You'll partner closely with engineering, product, and editorial folks to find elegant but practical solutions to design challenges.
  • Contribute to product strategy by defining problems in insightful ways, understanding business needs, and innovating within technical constraints.

Who You Are
  • You are an excellent human first, exhibiting kindness and compassion for your teammates and showing integrity in your actions and decisions.
  • You have at least 3 years of experience designing at consumer-focused tech or media companies.
  • Your online portfolio demonstrates a mastery of design fundamentals.
  • You have a people-focused design mentality. Even though you have incredible chops, you are constantly looking to hone your design instinct through user feedback. Whether through hands-on user research, or by designing options for an A/B test.
  • You have experience creating minimum viable products, utilizing rapid prototyping and iterative design techniques.
  • You have an innate passion for learning new software design technologies and trends.
  • You're autonomous and self-managed. You'll take full ownership your work, and you take responsibility for every last detail, every step of the way.
  • You embrace change and ambiguity as an opportunity for design to lead through innovation.
  • You are an active voice, consistently contributing to the greater good of the DSS design team.

Education & Experience
  • You have at least 3 years of experience designing at consumer-focused tech or media companies.
  • Your online portfolio demonstrates a mastery of design fundamentals.
  • You have experience creating minimum viable products, utilizing rapid prototyping and iterative design techniques.

If you've read through the requirements as a checklist and haven't ticked every box, don't rule yourself out just yet. We've seen that designers from under-represented groups, or untraditional professional backgrounds, bring a lot to the table that might not be covered here. If you think you have what it takes, hit that apply button!

Bubble enables thousands of businesses around the world to build software solutions without code. Our users use Bubble to build VC-backed startups, personal projects, and internal company tools. We are often a critical part of our customers’ operations and are very proud to help businesses achieve success through more accessible software.

About the role:

We are one of the fastest growing companies in the New York tech ecosystem: after a few years of bootstrapping and product development, we’re now deepening our focus on the Bubble community by hiring a Senior Community Manager. This is an exciting opportunity to drive Bubble’s community strategy and increase engagement by partnering with top users, organizing events, and keeping a close eye on our community’s health. As our first community manager, you’ll have the opportunity to define this critical role, and maintain the high level of transparency and communication that we pride ourselves on having with our exceptionally engaged community.  


As our Senior Community Manager, you will:

  • Develop and scale our community strategy by generating engagement initiatives, programs, and events
  • Manage Bubble’s forum and social media accounts (Twitter, LinkedIn, etc.)
  • Organize and run events for our community to gather feedback and provide clarity on product features and roadmap
  • Identify top users to promote, develop relationships and partner with
  • Define and monitor community health KPIs
  • Work closely with our Product and Marketing teams to develop a deep understanding of our product and guide the direction of our marketing campaigns


About you:

  • 4+ years of community management experience
  • People management experience is a plus
  • Social media experience is a plus
  • Possesses a deep understanding of online groups and communities
  • Exceptional interpersonal skills, and excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Strategic thinker, who can build thoughtful, data and insight driven plans
  • Proficiency in Excel, Sheets, or other spreadsheet/database tools used to structure data. Experience in SQL is a plus
  • Ability to identify and track relevant community metrics

If this sounds like you, apply!  If you don’t meet all of the qualifications but think you could be a match, we’d still love the chance to review your application. 


At Bubble, we encourage people from all ages, abilities, and experiences to apply. Bubble does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or family status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, pregnancy or caregiver status, veteran status, or any other legally protected status.


Bubble is very remote-friendly, and we have Bubble employees who work across the United States. You’ll be able to identify which state you plan to work in on your application. Note: at this time, we are only considering candidates who are authorized to work in the U.S.

monday.com is looking for a Marketing & Brand Designer with outstanding conceptual and visual design skills as well as a strong understanding of digital marketing across multiple channels. You will be responsible for strategically thinking through our seasonal campaigns, work on various brand-related projects internally and execute with great attention to detail in a way that aligns with our overall style guidelines.This is a great opportunity to take part in building and expanding our brand awareness through reaching millions of customers/ potential candidates around the world.

You’ll join our design team based in New York.


About The Role:
  • Develop or update brand identity, standards, and brand management tools as needed.
  • Innovate continually within a design team to build new or updated marketing campaigns that engage our customers and/or potential candidates
  • Communicate ideas and concepts clearly. Review work in an objective manner and with the aid of analytics, and apply learnings to future work.
  • Work collaboratively with marketing, PR, video, design, operations, HR and other stakeholders to gather information, understand the end goals and strategize communication approaches.
  • Design our website and develop new components while working on a clear design system
  • Take ownership of each project from the initial stages through to completion.

Requirements

  • A strong online design portfolio consisting of web-based marketing campaigns, brand identity and strong graphic principles.
  • Academic background in graphic design, visual/human interaction, or related field.
  • 3+ years of experience and a deep understanding of all stages of the design process focusing on online graphic and brand design skills.
  • Positive attitude with a willingness to put aside ego for the sake of what's best for the team
  • Great personality and social skills
  • Ability to adapt, switch gears, and thrive in a fast-paced environment
  • Excellent organizational skills and ability to prioritize and meet deadlines

BrainPOP is an online K-12 educational solution that makes rigorous learning experiences accessible and engaging for all. Proven to raise academic achievement, BrainPOP has been a trusted resource to more than six million educators, and engages the hearts and challenged the minds of over 300 million learners worldwide.

BrainPOP provides endless opportunities for kids to take agency over their learning through playful, knowledge-building content and learner-driven projects, preparing them for success in the classroom and beyond.

We’re seeking an Associate User Researcher to join our team. This junior position will report to the Associate Director of User Research.

As an Associate User Researcher, you will work with the user research team to elevate the voices and stories of the educators and kids who use our platform every day, and advocate for an inclusive design process. You will execute qualitative research that identifies authentic problems, solutions, and pain points for teachers, students, and/or school administrators. At the end of the day your insights will help improve our product and inspire our teams. Initiatives will entail evaluative design research and observational studies for some of our flagship products.

In this role, you will:

  • Join an active and collaborative UXR team
  • Participate in UXR team meetings and working sessions where we give and receive feedback on our work at all stages
  • Apply standard research recruiting practices and methods from the team playbook, with guidance
  • Become an embedded member of a BrainPOP product squad and represent UXR in squad meetings and planning activities
  • Become familiar with your squad's product and research roadmaps, and craft well-aligned research plans with support from your teammates
  • Take initiative to start work, ask for help when needed
  • Own the end-to-end execution of your research plan from recruiting through analysis
  • Create appropriate research artifacts (reports, maps, decks) to communicate your findings
  • Contribute to our repository of research insights for long-term learning
  • Connect with stakeholders across the company in areas such as data science, sales, and marketing

Who You Are

  • You have 1-2 years of experience with user research at a technology company, or comparable experience in another field. That means you are comfortable interviewing and observing people, and distilling findings and recommendations based on what you see and hear.
  • You have a knack for qualitative methods including interviews, observations, or surveys (for example)
  • You're comfortable writing research questions and aligning them to the appropriate methods
  • You've got a handle on the basics of planning and executing a study: writing discussion guides, leading interviews, crafting usability tasks or survey items
  • You have excellent communication, project management, analytical, and presentation skills
  • You can explain actionable insights from your research clearly to a variety of audiences
  • You are willing to go the extra mile to meet ethical standards – including having a keen eye for bias
  • You demonstrate a basic understanding of agile and product development workflows
  • You give and receive feedback with an open mind

Nice to Have

  • Experience in education, EdTech, and demonstrated knowledge of research methodologies in the social sciences
  • Advanced study in education, psychology, human-computer interaction, or another tech/media field that engages in qualitative research

Life at BrainPOP

Our commitment to supporting and empowering teachers and students is reflected in our dedication to enhancing the lives of our employees—in and out of the office.

Our team is made up of educators, data scientists, published authors, engineers, artists, bakers, film buffs, cyclists, dual-citizens, and so much more. We value Diversity & Inclusion, collaboration and learning from multiple perspectives, and encourage people to bring their most authentic selves to work.

Besides offering a comprehensive benefits package and putting an emphasis on work-life balance, we make it a point to integrate fun and play into the workplace.

We offer:

  • Corporate Donation Matching
  • Medical, Dental, Vision and Paid Life Insurance
  • 401K with a company match
  • Friends & Family BrainPOP Subscription
  • Learning & Development Stipend
  • Wellness Activities (ClassPass Membership)
  • Annual Performance Bonus & Equity Appreciation Plan
  • Company Events (happy hours, volunteering opportunities, trivia nights and monthly Town Halls)

What we do today directly impacts how teachers teach, and students learn. We continue to be inspired because we can see the difference we’re making and we’re proud to be a creative, collaborative, always-teaching and always-learning community.

We are able to employ remotely out of the following approved hiring states:

  • California
  • Connecticut
  • Florida
  • Georgia
  • Illinois
  • Massachusetts
  • Missouri
  • New Jersey
  • New York
  • North Carolina
  • Oregon
  • Pennsylvania
  • Tennessee
  • Texas
  • Illinois

We believe that a diverse organization is a more effective organization. BrainPOP is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.

Job Description We are looking for a creative and resourceful User Experience Research Lead with strong design research skills to join our rapidly growing team of innovators, disruptors and problem solvers.
Looking for someone who can think outside the box and provide fresh thought leadership, but we are also looking for an individual who will complement and embody our team culture - caring and empathizing with our customers, showing kindness, seeing a need or pain point and actively reaching out to help.
Responsibilities include, but not limited to:
  • Work with design and product leads in order to identify areas where user experience research can best provide insight and impact and develop research roadmaps
  • Design and lead research studies for strategic, durable insights as well as fast turnaround projects
  • Ensure research results are actionable and contribute directly to meeting project and business goals
  • Support other researchers as needed to ensure quality and consistency of deliverables and best practices. Coach and mentor junior team members
  • Contribute to next gen vision for the research function, identifying areas of opportunity or improvement, including identifying process improvements, new tools and approaches
  • Draw inferences from a wide range of types of data sources and studies
  • Inspire confidence and collaborate closely with a variety of internal and external stakeholders, across functions, and including product leadership and senior business executives.
  • Work with very senior stakeholders and provide top-executive-quality deliverables and input when needed

This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:
  • Bachelor's, Masters' or Ph.D. degree in related field preferred or equivalent relevant experience
  • 5-10+ years of experience planning and executing user research studies
  • Ability to drive multiple medium complexity initiatives with minimal guidance
  • Passionate for designing and delivering research for maximum impact and for developing world-class products and experiences
  • Ability to champion user experience research and integrate within the design planning, estimation, and prioritization process
  • Demonstrated ability to incorporate design thinking into the product development process
  • Clear articulate communication skills
  • Familiarity with banking and finance a plus
  • Experience with B2B research (not just consumer) an advantage
  • Portfolio or examples of past projects
  • Ability to train and mentor junior team members

About the Team Our Consumer & Community Banking division serves our Chase customers through a range of financial services, including personal banking, credit cards, mortgages, auto financing, investment advice, small business loans and payment processing. We're proud to lead the U.S. in credit card sales and deposit growth and have the most-used digital solutions - all while ranking first in customer satisfaction.
The Digital team is dedicated to creating innovative, industry-leading products and experiences that help customers access, share and control their financial data so they can make smart decisions with their money. Teams enable innovation while adhering to the firm's data sharing principles of security, customer control and convenience, and privacy.

ABOUT THE ROLE

Peloton is seeking an Associate User Researcher to support the innovation, iteration, and optimization of our digital presence and ecommerce store. With the support of the User Research team, this User Research Associate will collaborate with Research, Product and Design teams to enhance the quality of the web acquisition experience in meaningful and valuable ways. They will use qualitative and/or quantitative research to strategize and improve features and experiences developed by the web acquisition and membership teams. This role is ideal for someone who is passionate about user research, has subject matter expertise in the field and can lead multi-phased research studies across various acquisition workstreams. 

Outside of prior user research expertise, success in this role is dependent on being highly self-motivated, super organized, open to feedback, a great presenter, and collaborative. 

YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

  • Support researchers in moderate to high complexity projects; may lead low complexity/small scope projects with support
  • Take direction from other researchers in completing short- and long-term research plans; may engage in planning individual low complexity roadmaps
  • Develop and maintain effective research partnerships, primarily by supporting research execution and receiving research mentorship; engage in cross functional partnerships with support and guidance from research partners
  • Support lead researchers, product managers, and UX designers to understand Product and UX “questions to be answered” and manage expectations about methodology, timeline, and scope to investigate those questions
  • Conduct hands-on qualitative and/or quantitative research using a limited range of tools and approaches in order to gain mastery (e.g. interviews, ethnography, card sorting, surveys), primarily to address tactical research questions and produce new insights
  • Collaborate with research coordinators in sourcing and research logistics; play a direct role in research coordination in lieu of research coordinator as needed
  • With support, compile and present findings and recommendations for small and moderate complexity projects to the relevant partners in a clear and concrete way
  • For low complexity projects, own driving forward actionable insights to inform product improvements and the some strategic changes to the product roadmap; provide support for moderate and high complexity projects
  • Document and track research findings so insights can easily be referenced and applied for future projects

WHAT YOU BRING TO PELOTON

  • Familiar with basic usability testing and other primary research methods, but still learning and developing mastery of at least one
  • 1+ years of User Research and Testing experience and/or 2-4 years of research coordination experience
  • Analyze and synthesize basic data with guidance, and report it in a concise and concrete way
  • Support research processes and develop coordination processes to organize work across the research team
  • Strong problem solving skills; quantitative and analytical skills still developing
  • Learning remote and in person user research methodologies
  • Communicate effectively; developing effective storytelling skills
  • Eager to learn
  • Thrive on managing multiple priorities and completing projects
  • Open to learning new methodologies and tools
  • Work collaboratively in a team environment
  • Demonstrate initiative by acting as a self starter; operate with some autonomy and accept support and guidance that is offered
  • Operate with attention to detail

#LI-CM1

ABOUT PELOTON:

Peloton is the leading interactive fitness platform globally, with a passionate community of 7 million Members in the US, UK, Canada, Germany, and Australia. Peloton makes fitness entertaining, approachable, effective, and convenient, while fostering social connections that motivate its Members to commit to their fitness journeys. An innovator at the nexus of fitness, technology, and media, Peloton reinvented the fitness industry by developing a first-of-its-kind subscription platform that seamlessly combines the best equipment, proprietary networked software, world-class streaming digital fitness and wellness content, and best-in-class fitness experts and Instructors.

At Peloton, we motivate the world to live better. “Together We Go Far” means that we are greater than the sum of our parts, stronger collectively when each one of us is at our best. By combining hardware, software, content, retail, apparel, manufacturing, Member support, and so much more, we deliver an exhilarating fitness experience that unlocks our members' greatness. Join our team to unlock yours.

Peloton is an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive environment for all of our applicants. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. If you would like to request any accommodations from application through to interview, please email:  applicantaccommodations@onepeloton.com

Peloton has a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and customers globally. All employees based in the U.S. and Canada are required to provide proof of vaccination, unless the employee has a Peloton-approved reasonable accommodation or as otherwise required by law.

Please be aware that fictitious job openings, consulting engagements, solicitations, or employment offers may be circulated on the Internet in an attempt to obtain privileged information, or to induce you to pay a fee for services related to recruitment or training. Peloton does NOT charge any application, processing, or training fee at any stage of the recruitment or hiring process. All genuine job openings will be posted here on our careers page and all communications from the Peloton recruiting team and/or hiring managers will be from an @onepeloton.com email address. 

If you have any doubts about the authenticity of an email, letter or telephone communication purportedly from, for, or on behalf of Peloton, please email applicantaccommodations@onepeloton.com before taking any further action in relation to the correspondence.


Peloton does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Agencies should not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Peloton employees or any other organization location. Peloton is not responsible for any agency fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Job Description Your primary focus in this rolewill be on designing components, writing documentation, advocating for the system, collaborating with developers on creation and adoption, and governing the system. The primary goal of the role is to enable other designers and developers to be successful by focusing their efforts on product-level problems so that they can ship high-quality work efficiently and consistently.
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
  • Design systems and patterns that will allow product designers and front-end engineers to focus on product-level problems and ship high-quality work efficiently and consistently
  • Establish beautiful, expressive, and intuitive visual, motion, and interaction design with principles and patterns, across all of our product and platforms, like Web, iOS, and Android.
  • Presenting, demoing, and championing the system to other design and development teams to curate a cohesive experience for our advisors and clients
  • Provide guidelines and documentation that connects and resonates with the teams using our design systems.
  • Work with Product Designers, Software Engineers, and Design Technologists to develop and ship the system.
  • Write documentation and guidance on how and why components, styles, and patterns are applied in code and design.
  • Provide support and guidance to design and development consumers of the system

Qualifications
  • Bachelor's Degree (or equivalent practical work experience) in Research or Design
  • 3+ years of experience as a design systems or product designer at a digital product company, contributing to the design and visual execution of product experiences. At least 2 years of design systems experience required.
  • Knowledge of technical constraints and guidelines as they apply to designing for digital platforms, including web, iOS and Android. Awareness of inclusive design principles and best practices.
  • Advanced knowledge of Figma's design tool. Working knowledge of other contemporary design and prototyping tools, such as Framer or Principle.
  • Experience contributing to mature design systems including component design, documentation, and education.
  • Comfortable working with front end engineering teams for web and mobile user interfaces, including participating in code reviews. It's a big plus if you have had some hands-on experience and have contributed to code repositories for web or native apps.
  • Extremely high attention to detail. You set the bar for what we aim to do in our products.
  • You have the ability to synthesize complex, interdependent, and sometimes competing needs

Job Description We are looking for a profoundly engaged experience designer to join us. In this role, you will be part of a multi-disciplinary team of designers, planners and researchers committed to designing the future of commerce in banking. This role requires a deep understanding of experience design for digital products and services of all kinds, sizes, shapes and contexts.
The Designer will influence and help drive the direction, vision, and methodology for a growing team in our New York studio and set the bar for quality by example, with energy and passion. This will require a strong point of view on design, hands-on creation of experiences, developing strategies for implementation within a complex ecosystem and building meaningful relationships within the organization.
A user-centric view is paramount while providing simple, fun and innovatively enriching web and mobile experiences for our customers. You will be working in a fast-paced environment alongside our data, product and engineering teams to deliver new experiences (from Customer Journeys & Ecosystem Maps to Participatory Design Prototypes & Wireframes).
Knowledge, skills + experience:
A balanced understanding of strategy, research, interaction and visual design is a must. Finally, you are a customer experience advocate, excited about our customer's lives through simple, intelligent and enriching products and experiences.
  • BFA or BA in related field, graduate design degree preferred
  • 3+ years of experience in user experience design required.
  • Ability to synthesize complex, interdependent, and sometimes competing needs
  • Effective communication of design solutions across roles & levels
  • Awareness and practical understanding of current technologies, and their application and relevance to digital experiences
  • Proven understanding of responsive web & mobile application design and wireframe development
  • Experience with Native app design for both iPhone and Android
  • Experience with design thinking methodologies.
  • Solid communication and interpersonal skills
  • Thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative, team-oriented, cross-functional environment
  • Ability to influence others and provide thought leadership on design
  • Actively listens, hears and understands what is said and not said, and with nuanced comprehension of meaning and intent
  • Team work: Develops and sustains effective and cooperative working relationships with direct reports, peers, managers and other internal or external stakeholders
  • Flexibility/adaptability (ability to change direction based upon team and stakeholder consensus)
  • Proficient in the Design Tools like Figma

JPMorgan Chase was awarded the "WELL Health-Safety Rating" for all of our 6,200 locations globally based on our operational policies, maintenance protocols, stakeholder engagement and emergency plans to address a post-COVID-19 environment.
As a part of our commitment to health and safety, we have implemented various COVID-related health and safety requirements for our workforce. Employees are expected to follow the Firm's current COVID-19 or other infectious disease health and safety requirements, including local requirements. Requirements include sharing information including your vaccine card in the firm's vaccine record tool, and may include mask wearing. Requirements may change in the future with the evolving public health landscape. JPMorgan Chase will consider accommodation requests as required by applicable law.
Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans
About the Team Our Consumer & Community Banking division serves our Chase customers through a range of financial services, including personal banking, credit cards, mortgages, auto financing, investment advice, small business loans and payment processing. We're proud to lead the U.S. in credit card sales and deposit growth and have the most-used digital solutions - all while ranking first in customer satisfaction.
The Digital team is dedicated to creating innovative, industry-leading products and experiences that help customers access, share and control their financial data so they can make smart decisions with their money. Teams enable innovation while adhering to the firm's data sharing principles of security, customer control and convenience, and privacy.

job: Snap Lab Product Designer, System Design
job_desc:
Snap Inc. is a camera company. We believe that reinventing the camera represents our greatest opportunity to improve the way people live and communicate. Our products empower people to express themselves, live in the moment, learn about the world, and have fun together.

Snap Lab is home of the Spectacles brand and a world-class research & development team, working together to create the future of computing overlaid on the world around us.

We’re looking for a Product Designer to join the Spectacles Product Experience team to design innovative experiences for the next generation of cameras and wearable computers.


What you’ll do:

  • Invent the future of interactive, spatial, and social AR experiences for wearable AR devices

  • Collaborate with designers, engineers and product managers to, from concept to launch, for existing and future Snap Lab products

  • Create journey maps, flow diagrams, wireframes, mockups, prototypes, and other design artifacts to communicate design vision and gain alignment with cross-functional teams 

  • Conceive and define realistic product requirements for system features

  • Help define the short and long-term roadmap for your product area

  • Work directly with Prototypers, Engineers and UX Researchers to implement prototypes, provide feedback, execute user tests, and iterate on designs based on the data and user feedback

  • Document and deliver the final design specifications to partner engineering teams and champion the integration and quality assurance of those designs

  • Present your work directly to the CEO

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:

  • Ability to design 3D, spatial interfaces for AR/VR products

  • Proficiency with 3D design tools including Cinema 4D, Blender, Maya, or other similar tools

  • Excellent communication and presentation skills; ability to balance high level priorities and small details to clearly communicate design decisions to leadership, teammates, and engineers 

  • Familiarity with AR/VR prototyping tools including Unity, Lens Studio or other similar tools

  • Strong visual design skills and passion for interaction design

  • Ability to think through and define complex systems and user flow diagrams

  • Ability to think at a high level about product strategy and how interconnecting features fit together as part of a larger system

  • Strong interpersonal and leadership skills


Minimum Qualifications: 

  • BS/BA degree in a related field or equivalent years of experience

  • 3+ years professional experience designing for AR/VR products

  • Proficiency in Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator, or other design tools

  • A strong design portfolio showcasing your work and design skills

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience working with cross-functional teams

  • Experience working in a fast-paced, sometimes ambiguous work environment

  • Passion for Snapchat and Spectacles products!

At Snap, we believe that having a team of diverse backgrounds and voices working together will enable us to create innovative products that improve the way people live and communicate. Snap is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and committed to providing employment opportunities regardless of race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and breastfeeding, age, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification, in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws. EOE, including disability/vets. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please don’t be shy and contact us at accommodations-ext@snap.com.

Our Benefits: Snap Inc. is its own community, so we’ve got your back! We do our best to make sure you and your loved ones have everything you need to be happy and healthy, on your own terms. Our benefits are built around your needs and include paid maternity & paternity leave, comprehensive medical coverage, emotional and mental health support programs, and compensation packages that let you share in Snap’s long-term success!

What is BlockFi?

BlockFi’s mission is to provide liquidity, transparency and efficiency to digital financial markets by creating products that meet the needs of consumers and corporations across the globe. We build bridges between traditional finance and digital markets that enable growth for all participants.

We’re a team of builders and strivers, proud to champion financial inclusivity and offer economic opportunities around the globe. We provide the same inclusivity to our team members. BlockFi is a place where diversity is celebrated, individuality is recognized, and every single team member is valued. We are changing the status quo to be the first financial company that people love, and we rely on our people to make it happen!

BlockFi is looking for a Senior Product Designer to join our growing team! 

About Your Team

We are a small team dedicated to building out a suite of top-tier trading, lending, risk management, and operational tools for ourselves and our clients. The team is currently composed of front and backend engineers, Product, and QA individuals who are based on both coasts of the US. We are highly collaborative and value quick sync ups over big meetings.

Your Mission

We are looking for a Senior Product Designer comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and ready to join our rapidly growing, industry defining financial services team. In this role you’ll closely collaborate with product and engineering to build out core features of a young B2B product. You’ll be responsible for the usability and aesthetics of new features in a suite of tools and will have influence on the product roadmap.

Responsibilities:

  • Partner with Product, Engineering, and the Business to develop multi-faceted tools used by our financial services team and our clients
  • Own the functionality, design, and interactions of new features
  • Drive design iterations of existing features continuously improving our offering
  • Utilize modern tools and technologies for deliverables
  • Manage all the stages of the visual design lifecycle including ideation, wireframing, design, and validating the end product meets specs.
  • Familiar with accessibility standards and able to design within them

Your Expertise:

  • 3+ years of product design experience
  • Has examples of shipped projects where you were the primary designer
  • Excited about building out design patterns for a new product
  • Excited about owning and developing design lifecycle/processes
  • Pragmatic approach to design and focused on usability
  • Ability to know when to compromise without sacrificing user experience or design principles
  • Mastery of design tools & craft: Figma, design systems, and responsive design
  • Confident and humble
  • Talented at receiving and incorporating feedback in an agile process
  • Bonus points: experience in Fin-tech and crypto technologies

Your Perks:

We benefit from the great work our employees do each day. That is why we are committed to providing a variety of awesome benefits to help them live their best lives.

  • Competitive salary because we value your experience and expertise
  • Unlimited vacation / sick days  because everyone deserves time for R&R
  • Employer contribution towards health coverage (including vision & dental) because your physical health and well-being is important to us 
  • Various fringe benefits such as 401k, Parental Leave, FSA/HSA, and Employee Assistance Programs because health coverage is more than just choosing your yearly plan 
  • Flexible work environment because we are a geographically dispersed team and we believe in balance
  • Pet insurance because all of your beloved family members should have coverage too
  • A close-knit team of enthusiastic, collegial and driven people to work alongside in a highly meritocratic environment because teamwork makes the dreamwork

Why BlockFi?

BlockFi has experienced incredible growth since our launch in August 2017. Our client base has grown to more than 225,000 (and counting), and the company now boasts more than $15 billion in assets on our platform. We recently completed a Series D funding round placing the company's valuation at $3 billion, and our team now has more than 500 people worldwide. We have established ourselves as a crypto market leader, and as we expand our product suite and geographic footprint, we expect our addressable market to grow exponentially.

BlockFi's leadership team has decades of experience in the traditional financial services and banking world, and we take a conservative approach to regulation that will position us well for sustainable long-term growth and expansion.

Our team is comprised of highly motivated professionals from diverse backgrounds. We are aiming to become the leading lender in crypto and are poised to redefine the global financial ecosystem for the better. In addition:

  • BlockFi is one of the first companies to ever offer crypto-backed loans and the only company whose founding team has an institutional understanding of the debt capital markets and regulatory landscape in the U.S.
  • $100 MM of Series A, B, and C funding led by Valar Ventures with participation from Susquehanna, Winklevoss Capital, Fidelity, Galaxy Digital, Akuna Capital, and Morgan Creek
  • $350 MM of Series D funding led by Bain Capital Ventures, partners of DST Global, Pomp Investments and Tiger Global
  • We are moving quickly and have already deployed substantial capital into the space, proving our ability to execute and capture customer demand

For information about how we collect, use, or otherwise handle your Personal Information, please see our Privacy Policy.

About Transfix:
 
Transfix, named to Forbes’ “Next Billion-Dollar Startups” list, is the leading transportation solutions provider whose digital brokerage marketplace and logistics software offerings are helping transform the $800 billion trucking industry. Since its founding in 2013, Transfix has been driven by a mission to deliver simple, smart, and sustainable solutions for shippers and carriers, powered by people and technology.
 
Here at Transfix, we are not only building incredible technology solving some of the world’s biggest, most complex, and most important challenges in the freight and logistics industry; We are also helping protect our environment and are passionate about making the world a better place by increasing sustainability and eliminating the extreme amount of waste that currently exists in our industry.
 
By combining deep industry expertise and a best in class carrier network with cutting-edge technology, Transfix is reimagining the world of transportation. Transfix works with some of the largest Fortune 500 companies such as Staples, Unilever, Target and Wayfair rely on Transfix to handle their most important FTL freight needs. With instant pricing, algorithmic matching, superior service, and unmatched intelligence, Transfix is optimizing the supply chain from start to finish. 
 
The problems we solve everyday are real and require creativity, grit, and determination. Recognized as one of Built In’s Best Places to Work 2021, Transfix is building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. We’re hiring team members who are passionate and are energized by the vision to simplify and transform one of the largest and most complex industries through technology, data and a strong commitment to customers. 

About the Role:

Transfix is growing in exciting ways, and we’re looking for a Senior Product Designer to join our Product Team. In this role, you’ll partner closely with our engineering and product team, playing an integral part in our product design processes and workflows as we continue to build and develop our existing and new products on our roadmap.

If you’re passionate about product design, but have a keen eye for process and workflows, and want to be a part of solving real problems in a critical industry, then please keep reading!

**A link to your online portfolio, or a PDF, is required. Applications without a portfolio are unlikely to be considered

What you'll do in this role:

  • Lead product design efforts utilizing design best practices and contribute to product strategy
  • Develop multiple solutions across the entire product lifecycle and manage launches in a fast-paced environment.
  • Incorporate human-centered design techniques to identify pain points, generate ideas, help define requirements, and drive design initiatives in a lean, agile environment.
  • Work with small multi-disciplinary teams. You'll partner closely with engineering, product, and business folks to find elegant but practical solutions to design challenges 
  • Advocate and be the voice for our users; understand the jobs they are trying to accomplish, their pain points, unmet needs, and be able to translate feedback into strategic solutions
  • Day to day work includes conducting user research, producing wireframes and user flows, prototyping at varying levels of fidelity, and validating concepts with end-users and stakeholders to turn insights into value-adding features and actionable deliverables
  • Help develop, further define, and apply Transfix’s sensibilities, methodologies, and culture to design practice
  • Clearly present your ideas, designs, and decisions to stakeholders and fellow designers
  • Overall, contribute to product team growth, vision, and strategy

You’re an Excellent Fit for this Role if You Bring:

  • 4+ years at design-driven technology companies or startups.
  • A user-focused design mentality. Even though you have incredible chops, you look to understand user needs in order to hone your design instincts, whether that be through user feedback or designing options for A/B tests to rapidly iterate and validate your hypotheses.
  • Masterful communication; you have the communication skills to help set up frameworks and brainstorm initial design concepts. You also can work cross-functionally to involve product, engineering, and business stakeholders in the design process.
  • Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving capability. You love to break down and simplify complex problems and you are confident to present to mixed audiences at different levels of the organization. 
  • A love of dreaming up innovative, human-centered solutions for an industry that employs 3 million truck drivers and powers the domestic economy. You have a knack for inspiring others to see opportunities for innovation as well.
  • A bias toward action; if you’re blocked, you find creative solutions to get around the obstacle. Your work doesn’t end when features ship, but rather when it’s accomplished the objectives you defined before you ever got started 
  • You have an online portfolio that showcases your work.

What You can Expect from Transfix

  • This role is 100% remote, however we have offices in New York, NY and Atlanta, GA, so if you live near these places, you're welcome to come in as you'd like.
  • We are offering a market competitive salary depending on experience level, scope, and geographic location, which includes base cash salary as well as Restricted Stock Units (equity) in Transfix.
  • We offer 100% company paid medical, dental, and vision health benefit premiums. That's $0 out of your paycheck!
  • We offer 3 months of parental leave, fertility coverage, childcare support, pet insurance, gym reimbursement, unlimited sick days, generous PTO, and have 7 company holidays + 3 floating holidays.
  • Career growth! We are growing quickly and prioritize developing our teams to meet their full potential and promoting from within.
  • A commitment to Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, Justice, and Sustainability. Approximately 40% of our executive Leadership team is female, and half of our employee population is BIPOC. We have several incredible Employee Resource Groups (ERGs), such as Pride@, Somos@, ForTheCulture@, AAPI@ and Women@, and are committed to continuously improving diversity and inclusion every single day.

#LI-Remote
#LI-DR1

 
Transfix is deeply committed to advancing diversity, equity, inclusion, and justice in our hiring, programming, and in our work both internally and externally. We recognize how critical diversity, equity, inclusion, and justice are to achieving our mission, our growth, and our success. In support of this commitment, some of our focuses include (but are not limited to):
  • Developing policies, procedures, and services to our employees, carriers, and shippers that uplift and protect to prevent inequalities
  • Building relationships among our employees, customers, and supporters that are reflective of our community
  • Prioritizing the inclusion of diverse communities and underrepresented groups in internal leadership
  • Fostering a culture of compassion, empathy, open-mindedness, compassion, and inclusivity
  • Creating and maintaining opportunities for continuous education, discourse, and engagement related to issues of equity, diversity, inclusion, and social justice
Transfix is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Transfix are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, and are made without regard to race, creed, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy or related condition (including breastfeeding), or any other basis protected by law. It is Transfix’s policy to comply with all applicable national, state and local laws pertaining to nondiscrimination and equal opportunity. Transfix does not and will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Transfix encourages applicants of all ages.
 
To all recruitment agencies: Transfix does not accept unsolicited agency resumes and will not be held responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Since its launch in 1993 with a collection of six essential handbags, Kate Spade New York has always stood for optimistic femininity. Today, the brand is a global life and style house with handbags, ready-to-wear, jewelry, footwear, gifts, home décor and more. Polished ease, thoughtful details and a modern, sophisticated use of color-Kate Spade New York's founding principles define a unique style synonymous with joy.
Kate Spade New York is part of the Tapestry portfolio - a global house of brands powered by optimism, innovation, and inclusivity.
Job Title: Assistant Designer, Mainline
Primary Purpose: To conceptualize, create, and develop designs for Mainline tech accessories and supporting small leather goods.
The successful individual will leverage their proficiency in design to...
  • support the design process from conception through production
  • responsible for market / new innovations / trend research and the communication of design ideas
  • provide recommendations regarding seasonal themes, edits to line, new concepts, etc.
  • ensure that product is of high quality and consistent with market trends, as well as business strategy.
  • work with pre-production partner for tech accessories and small leather goods to ensure design packages are complete and accurate.
  • work collaboratively with the design team to design/spec tech accessories and small leather goods
  • create highly detailed specs
  • work with merchandising and sales teams and assist in determining sales need
  • collaborate and develop close working relationships with tech design, merchandising, production, the CAD team, sourcing offices and vendors to ensure the quality, delivery and business practices are achieved and upheld.

The accomplished individual will possess...
  • bachelors degree in a related field preferred but not required
  • 1-2 years experience
  • experience in Photoshop and Illustrator
  • hand sketch.
  • knowledge of raw materials, as well as, construction techniques.
  • strong communication and organizational skills.

We are hiring a Senior Graphic Designer to join us in our mission to transform the way therapeutics and materials are discovered.
Schrödinger has pioneered a physics-based software platform that enables discovery of high-quality, novel molecules for drug development and materials applications more rapidly and at lower cost compared to traditional methods. The software platform is used by biopharmaceutical and industrial companies, academic institutions, and government laboratories around the world. Our multidisciplinary drug discovery team also leverages the software platform to advance collaborative programs and its own pipeline of novel therapeutics to address unmet medical needs.
Who will love this job:
  • A curious creator with a passion for science
  • A graphic designer who wants to join an internal design team to partner across all functions, departments, and regions
  • A savvy storyteller who can communicate complex scientific concepts in a coherent and compelling way across all media
  • An ethical team player with unquestionable integrity and discretion
  • A self-directed, self-motivated, detailed collaborator who can work under pressure with a positive attitude
  • Creator who has a passion for all things design ... and did we mention science?

What you'll do:
  • Creatively execute visualizations of highly technical, scientific concepts to support the company's corporate narrative
  • Develop visually compelling slide decks and presentations based on highly technical scientific data
  • Support specific projects across the different teams within Schrödinger, including Investor Relations/Corporate Affairs, Marketing, Materials Science and Drug Discovery
  • Help promote Schrödinger's brand across multiple social media channels
  • Assist in all website design stages from concept to final hand-off to developers
  • Present and defend designs and key deliverables to peers and executive level stakeholders
  • Conceptualize, design, and produce creative content for a broad range of audiences across diverse channels and media - working within all areas of design including but not limited to presentations, print, digital, branding, video, animation, event and marketing materials
  • Help develop and promote the corporate brand guidelines, as well as help maintain our BrandFolder account with the most up-to-date branded content

What you should have:
  • At least three years of graphic design experience within an agency or in-house at a life sciences, pharma, or scientific communications company
  • At least a Bachelor's degree in graphic design or equivalent experience (a Bachelor's degree in a scientific discipline is a plus!)
  • Experience creating high-quality infographics and PowerPoint presentations, depicting highly technical information in a visually compelling and digestible format
  • Experience designing small- to large-scale websites, from site map to prototype (HTML and CSS knowledge a plus)
  • High proficiency with applicable computer applications, including Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, etc.), G Suite and Microsoft Office
  • Experience and interest in creating motion graphics and video content
  • Excellent organizational acumen with a belief in only inventing the wheel once
  • An interest and deep knowledge of branding principles and its execution
  • Strong attention to detail

Pay and perks:
Schrödinger understands it's people that make a company great. Because of this, we're prepared to offer a competitive salary, stock options, and a wide range of benefits that include healthcare (with dental and vision), a 401k, pre-tax commuter benefits, a flexible work schedule, and a parental leave program. We have catered meals in the office every day, a company culture that is relaxed but engaged, and over a month of paid vacation time. Our Administrative and Human Resources departments also plan a myriad of fun company-wide events. New York is home to our largest office, but we have teams all over the world. Schrödinger is honored to have been selected as one of Crain's New York Best Places to Work for the last three consecutive years.
Sound exciting? Apply today and join us!
As an equal opportunity employer, Schrödinger hires outstanding individuals into every position in the company. People who work with us have a high degree of engagement, a commitment to working effectively in teams, and a passion for the company's mission. We place the highest value on creating a safe environment where our employees can grow and contribute, and refuse to discriminate on the basis of race, color, religious belief, sex, age, disability, national origin, alienage or citizenship status, marital status, partnership status, caregiver status, sexual and reproductive health decisions, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected characteristic. To us, "diversity" isn't just a buzzword, but an important element of our core principles and key business practices. We believe that diverse companies innovate better and think more creatively than homogenous ones because they take into account a wide range of viewpoints. For us, greater diversity doesn't mean better headlines or public images - it means increased adaptability and profitability.
